dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits peat and streams (Ref. 84801).  Occasionally seen in aquarium trades (Ref. 57235).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Muar River drainage, southern Malay Peninsula.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Muar drainage in southern Malay Peninsula, Malaysia (Ref. 33074) and Kapuas basin in western Borneo, Indonesia (Ref. 2091).
dataObjects.references: Ng, H.H. and M. Kottelat 1998 Hyalobagrus, a new genus of miniature bagrid catfish from Southeast Asia (Teleostei: Siluriformes). Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 9(4):335-346. (Ref. 33074)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 1; Dorsal soft rays (total): 6; Analsoft rays: 21 - 22; Vertebrae: 37 - 38

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Vidthayanon, C. 2002 Peat swamp fishes of Thailand. Office of Environmental Policy and Planning, Bangkok, Thailand, 136 p. (Ref. 57235)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Presence of serrae on distal three quarters of anterior edge of pectoral spine; body depth at anus 19.2-19.4% SL; black margin of dorsal fin present; eye diameter 19.7-22.7% HL; and length of adipose-fin base 15.6-15.7% SL.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: demersal; freshwater; pH range: 6.6 - 7.2; dH range: 18

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Hyalobagrus ornatus
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Hyalobagrus ornatus." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 10 Mar 2013, 08:58 UTC. 2 Feb 2015 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hyalobagrus_ornatus&oldid=645286879>.
dataObjects.description:
Hyalobagrus ornatus is a species of bagrid catfish found in Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand. It is found in the Muar River drainage in the southern Malay Peninsula of Malaysia and Thailand and Kapuas basin in western Borneo. It occurs in streams and peat swamps.

References[edit]

  • Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2011). "Hyalobagrus ornatus" in FishBase. December 2011 version.
